body:
[![Logo](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/raw/v0/logo/logo.svg "Logo")](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon "Logo") # crymon ORM-like API MongoDB for Crystal.
For simulate relationship Many-to-One and Many-to-Many,
a simplified alternative (Types of selective fields with dynamic addition of elements) is used.
The project is focused on web development. [![Specs](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/workflows/Specs/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/actions) [![Docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-available-brightgreen.svg)](https://kebasyaty.github.io/crymon/) [![Crystal](https://img.shields.io/badge/crystal-v1.10%2B-red)](https://crystal-lang.org/) [![Github all releases](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/kebasyaty/crymon/total.svg)](https://GitHub.com/kebasyaty/crymon/releases/) [![GitHub license](https://badgen.net/github/license/kebasyaty/crymon)](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/blob/v0/LICENSE)

_Compatible with MongoDB 3.6+. Tested against: 7.0, 6.0._
_For more information see [Cryomongo](https://github.com/elbywan/cryomongo "Cryomongo")_.

## Requirements [View the list of requirements.](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/blob/v0/REQUIREMENTS.md "View the list of requirements.") ## Installation 1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: crymon: github: kebasyaty/crymon ``` 2. Run `shards install` ## Usage ```crystal require "crymon" ``` TODO: Write usage instructions here ## Development TODO: Write development instructions here ## License **This project is licensed under the** [MIT](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/blob/v0/LICENSE "MIT"). ## Changelog [View the change history.](https://github.com/kebasyaty/crymon/blob/v0/CHANGELOG.md "View the change history.") ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [kebasyaty](https://github.com/kebasyaty) Gennady Kostyunin - creator and maintainer

types.name: Crymon
types.doc:
ORM-like API MongoDB for Crystal.
For simulate relationship Many-to-One and Many-to-Many,
a simplified alternative (Types of selective fields with dynamic addition of elements) is used.
The project is focused on web development.

_Compatible with MongoDB 3.6+. Tested against: 6.0, 7.0._
_For more information see [Cryomongo](https://github.com/elbywan/cryomongo "Cryomongo")_.
types.summary: ORM-like API MongoDB for Crystal.

types.name: Caching
types.doc: For caching Model metadata.
types.summary: For caching Model metadata.

instance_methods.name: caching
instance_methods.doc: Add metadata to the global store.

def.name: caching
def.body:
{% if @type.instance_vars.size < 4 %}
        # If there are no fields in the model, a FieldsMissing exception is raise.
        raise Crymon::Errors::ModelFieldsMissing
          .new({{ @type.name.stringify }}.split("::").last)
    {% end %}
model_name : String = (({{ @type.name.stringify }}).split("::")).last
if model_name.size > 25
  raise(Crymon::Errors::ModelNameExcessChars.new(model_name))
end
if Crymon::Globals.cache_regex[:model_name].matches?(model_name)
else
  raise(Crymon::Errors::ModelNameRegexFails.new(model_name, "/^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]{0,24}$/"))
end
service_name : String = ({{ (@type.annotation(Crymon::Meta))[:service_name] }}) || (raise(Crymon::Errors::MetaParameterMissing.new(model_name, "service_name")))
if service_name.size > 25
  raise(Crymon::Errors::MetaParamExcessChars.new(model_name, "service_name", 25))
end
if Crymon::Globals.cache_regex[:service_name].matches?(service_name)
else
  raise(Crymon::Errors::MetaParamRegexFails.new(model_name, "service_name", "/^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]{0,24}$/"))
end
collection_name : String = "#{service_name}_#{model_name}"
field_name_and_type_list : Hash(String, String) = (fields = Hash(String, String).new
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        unless @{{ var }}.is_ignored
          fields[{{ var.name.stringify }}] = {{ var.type.stringify }}.split("::").last
        end
      {% end %}
fields)
default_value_list : Hash(String, Crymon::Globals::ValueTypes) = (fields = Hash(String, Crymon::Globals::ValueTypes).new
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        unless @{{ var }}.is_ignored
          fields[{{ var.name.stringify }}] = @{{ var }}.default
        end
      {% end %}
fields)
is_use_hash_slug : Bool = (flag : Bool = false
field_name_list : Array(String) = field_name_and_type_list.keys << "hash"
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        if @{{ var }}.field_type == "SlugField"
          # Throw an exception if a non-existent field is specified.
          @{{ var }}.get_slug_sources.each do |source_name|
            unless field_name_list.includes?(source_name)
              raise Crymon::Errors::SlugSourceInvalid
                .new(model_name, {{ var.name.stringify }}, source_name)
            end
          end
          # Check the presence of a hash field.
          if !flag && @{{ var }}.get_slug_sources.includes?("hash")
            flag = true
          end
        end
      {% end %}
flag)
ignore_fields : Array(String) = (fields = Array(String).new
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        if @{{ var }}.is_ignored
          fields << {{ var.name.stringify }}
        end
      {% end %}
fields)
field_attrs : Hash(String, NamedTuple(id: String, name: String)) = (fields = Hash(String, NamedTuple(id: String, name: String)).new
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        fields[{{ var.name.stringify }}] = {
          id: "#{{{ @type.name.stringify }}
            .split("::")
            .last}--#{{{ var.name.stringify }}
            .gsub("_", "-")}",
          name: {{ var.name.stringify }}
        }
      {% end %}
fields)
time_object_list : Hash(String, NamedTuple(default: Time | ::Nil, max: Time | ::Nil, min: Time | ::Nil)) = (hash = Hash(String, NamedTuple(default: Time | ::Nil, max: Time | ::Nil, min: Time | ::Nil)).new
default_time : Time | ::Nil
max_time : Time | ::Nil
min_time : Time | ::Nil
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        if @{{ var }}.field_type.includes?("Date")
          if @{{ var }}.field_type == "DateField"
            default_time = !@{{ var }}.default.nil? ? self.date_parse(@{{ var }}.default.to_s) : nil
            max_time = !@{{ var }}.max.nil? ? self.date_parse(@{{ var }}.max.to_s) : nil
            min_time = !@{{ var }}.min.nil? ? self.date_parse(@{{ var }}.min.to_s) : nil
          elsif @{{ var }}.field_type == "DateTimeField"
            default_time = !@{{ var }}.default.nil? ? self.datetime_parse(@{{ var }}.default.to_s) : nil
            max_time = !@{{ var }}.max.nil? ? self.datetime_parse(@{{ var }}.max.to_s) : nil
            min_time = !@{{ var }}.min.nil? ? self.datetime_parse(@{{ var }}.min.to_s) : nil
          end
          hash[{{ var.name.stringify }}] = {default: default_time, max: max_time, min: min_time}
          default_time = max_time = min_time = nil
        end
      {% end %}
hash)
Crymon::Globals.cache_metadata[model_key] = {model_name: model_name, service_name: service_name, collection_name: collection_name, db_query_docs_limit: ({{ (@type.annotation(Crymon::Meta))[:db_query_docs_limit] }}) || 1000_u32, field_count: {{ @type.instance_vars.size }}, field_name_and_type_list: field_name_and_type_list, default_value_list: default_value_list, is_saving_docs: ({{ (@type.annotation(Crymon::Meta))[:is_saving_docs] }}) || true, is_updating_docs: ({{ (@type.annotation(Crymon::Meta))[:is_updating_docs] }}) || true, is_deleting_docs: ({{ (@type.annotation(Crymon::Meta))[:is_deleting_docs] }}) || true, is_use_hash_slug: is_use_hash_slug, ignore_fields: ignore_fields, field_attrs: field_attrs, data_dynamic_fields: Hash(String, String).new, time_object_list: time_object_list}

constructors.args_html: (label : String = "", default : Bool | Nil = false, is_hide : Bool = false, is_required : Bool = false, is_disabled : Bool = false, is_readonly : Bool = false, is_ignored : Bool = false, other_attrs : String = "", css_classes : String = "", hint : String = "")

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(label, default, is_hide, is_required, is_disabled, is_readonly, is_ignored, other_attrs, css_classes, hint)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end

class_methods.name: valid_app_name
class_methods.doc:
App name = Project name.
WARNING: Maximum 44 characters.
WARNING: Match regular expression: /^[a-zA-Z][-_a-zA-Z0-9]{0,43}$/

def.name: valid_app_name
def.body:
if app_name.size > 44
  raise(Crymon::Errors::CacheSettingsExcessChars.new("cache_app_name", 44))
end
if Crymon::Globals.cache_regex[:app_name].matches?(app_name)
else
  raise(Crymon::Errors::CacheSettingsRegexFails.new("cache_app_name", "/^[a-zA-Z][-_a-zA-Z0-9]{0,43}$/"))
end

class_methods.name: valid_unique_app_key
class_methods.doc:
Unique project key.
WARNING: Match regular expression: /^[a-zA-Z0-9]{16}$/

def.name: valid_unique_app_key
def.body:
if unique_app_key.size > 16
  raise(Crymon::Errors::CacheSettingsExcessChars.new("cache_unique_app_key", 16))
end
if Crymon::Globals.cache_regex[:unique_app_key].matches?(unique_app_key)
else
  raise(Crymon::Errors::CacheSettingsRegexFails.new("cache_unique_app_key", "/^[a-zA-Z0-9]{16}$/"))
end

def.name: validation
def.body:
self.valid_app_name(Crymon::Globals.cache_app_name)
self.valid_unique_app_key(Crymon::Globals.cache_unique_app_key)
if Crymon::Globals.cache_database_name.empty?
  app_name = Crymon::Globals.cache_app_name
  unique_app_key = Crymon::Globals.cache_unique_app_key
  Crymon::Globals.cache_database_name = "#{app_name}_#{unique_app_key}"
else
  self.valid_database_name(Crymon::Globals.cache_database_name)
end

instance_methods.name: migrat
instance_methods.doc:
Run migration process.
1) Update the state of Models in the super collection.
2) Add models states to the super collection if missing.
3) Check the changes in the models and (if necessary) apply to the database.
4) Delete data for non-existent Models from a super collection and delete collections associated with those Models.

def.name: migrat
def.body:
self.refresh
@model_key_list.each do |model_key|
  metadata : Crymon::Globals::CacheMetaDataType = Crymon::Globals.cache_metadata[model_key]
  if metadata[:is_saving_docs]
  else
    next
  end
  database : Mongo::Database = Crymon::Globals.cache_mongo_client[Crymon::Globals.cache_database_name]
  super_collection : Mongo::Collection = database[Crymon::Globals.cache_super_collection_name]
  model_state, is_next = (  filter = {collection_name: metadata[:collection_name]}
  document = super_collection.find_one(filter)
  if document.nil?
    m_state = Crymon::Migration::ModelState.new(collection_name: metadata[:collection_name], field_name_and_type_list: metadata[:field_name_and_type_list], is_model_exists: true)
    super_collection.insert_one(m_state.to_bson)
    database.command(Mongo::Commands::Create, name: m_state.collection_name)
    {m_state, true}
  else
    m_state = Crymon::Migration::ModelState.from_bson(document)
    m_state.is_model_exists = true
    {m_state, false}
  end)
  if is_next
    next
  end
  ignore_fields : Array(String) = metadata[:ignore_fields]
  if model_state.field_name_and_type_list != metadata[:field_name_and_type_list]
    default_value_list = metadata[:default_value_list]
    old_field_name_list : Array(String) = model_state.field_name_and_type_list.keys
    missing_fields : Array(String) = old_field_name_list - metadata[:field_name_and_type_list].keys
    new_fields = Array(String).new
    metadata[:field_name_and_type_list].each do |field_name, field_type|
      old_field_type : String | ::Nil = model_state.field_name_and_type_list[field_name]?
      if old_field_type.nil? || (old_field_type != field_type)
        new_fields << field_name
      end
    end
    model_collection : Mongo::Collection = database[metadata[:collection_name]]
    cursor : Mongo::Cursor = model_collection.find
    cursor.each do |document|
      freshed_document = BSON.new({_id: document["_id"]})
      old_field_name_list.each do |field_name|
        if missing_fields.includes?(field_name)
        else
          freshed_document[field_name] = document[field_name]
        end
      end
      new_fields.each do |field_name|
        document[field_name] = (        if metadata[:field_name_and_type_list][field_name].includes?("Date")
          metadata[:time_object_list][field_name][:default]
        else
          default_value_list[field_name]
        end)
      end
      filter = {_id: freshed_document["_id"]}
      update = {"$set": freshed_document}
      model_collection.update_one(filter, update)
    end
  end
  model_state.data_dynamic_fields.each do |field_name, data|
    metadata[:data_dynamic_fields][field_name] = data
  end
  model_state.field_name_and_type_list = metadata[:field_name_and_type_list]
  filter = {collection_name: model_state.collection_name}
  update = {"$set": model_state}
  super_collection.update_one(filter, update)
end

types.name: Model
types.doc:
Abstraction for converting Crystal structures into Crymon Models.

Simple example:
```
@[Crymon::Meta(service_name: "Accounts")]
struct User < Crymon::Model
  getter username = Crymon::Fields::TextField.new
  getter birthday = Crymon::Fields::DateField.new
end
```

Extended example:
```
@[Crymon::Meta(
  service_name: "Accounts",
  is_deleting_docs: false
)]
struct User < Crymon::Model
  getter username = Crymon::Fields::TextField.new(
    "label": "Username",
    "maxlength": 150,
    "minlength": 1,
    "regex": "^[a-zA-Z0-9_@.+]$",
    "regex_err_msg": "Allowed chars: a-z A-Z 0-9 _ @ . +",
    "is_required": true,
    "is_unique": true
  )
  getter email = Crymon::Fields::EmailField.new(
    "label": "E-mail",
    "maxlength": 320,
    "is_required": true,
    "is_unique": true
  )
  getter birthday = Crymon::Fields::DateField.new(
    "label": "Birthday",
  )
  getter slug = Crymon::Fields::SlugField.new(
    "label": "Slug",
    "slug_sources": ["hash", "username"]
  )
  getter password = Crymon::Fields::PasswordField.new(
    "label": "Password",
  )
  # Do not save the value of this field to the database.
  # This field is for verification purposes only.
  getter confirm_password = Crymon::Fields::PasswordField.new(
    "label": "Confirm password",
    "is_ignored": true
  )
  getter is_active: Crymon::Fields::BoolField.new(
    "label": "is active?",
    "default": true
  )
end
```
types.summary: Abstraction for converting Crystal structures into Crymon Models.

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc:
Generates an `UInt64` hash value for this object.

This method must have the property that `a == b` implies `a.hash == b.hash`.

The hash value is used along with `==` by the `Hash` class to determine if two objects
reference the same hash key.

Subclasses must not override this method. Instead, they must define `hash(hasher)`,
though usually the macro `def_hash` can be used to generate this method.
instance_methods.summary: Generates an UInt64 hash value for this object.

def.name: inject
def.body:
metadata : Crymon::Globals::CacheMetaDataType = Crymon::Globals.cache_metadata[model_key]
var_name : String = ""
json : String | ::Nil
{% for var in @type.instance_vars %}
        var_name = {{ var.name.stringify }}
        field_attrs = metadata[:field_attrs][var_name]
        @{{ var }}.id = field_attrs[:id]
        @{{ var }}.name = field_attrs[:name]
        # Add dynamic field data from the cache to the Model.
        if json = metadata[:data_dynamic_fields][var_name]?
          @{{ var }}.set_choices(json)
        end
      {% end %}

class_methods.name: delete_test_db
class_methods.doc:
Delete database (before|after) test.

Example:
```
# Data for test.
# To generate a key (This is not an advertisement): https://randompasswordgen.com/
unique_app_key = "jeKZ9lIGL9aLRvlz"
database_name = "test_#{unique_app_key}"
database = Crymon::Globals.cache_mongo_client[database_name]
# Delete the database for the test.
Crymon::Tools::Test.delete_test_db(database)
```

def.name: delete_test_db
def.body:
cursor = database.list_collections(name_only: true)
cursor.each do |collection|
  database.command(Mongo::Commands::Drop, name: collection["name"].as(Int32 | String))
end
